channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Pourquoi la fréquence des processeurs plafonne à 5 GHz depuis 20 ans
item.description: Vous vous souvenez des années 2000 ? À l'époque, la puissance d'un PC se résumait à un chiffre : les MHz. On nous promettait des processeurs à 10 GHz pour 2010. Comme vous l'avez observé, ça n'est jamais arrivé. Voici pourquoi la physique nous a imposé un plafond de verre thermique.

item.title: Spyware maker sentenced to prison in Greece for wiretapping politicians and journalists
item.description: A Greek court on Thursday sentenced the founder of Intellexa, a collective of spyware makers, to eight years in prison for illegal wiretapping and privacy violations, according to several reports. Tal Dilian and three other Intellexa executives were tried for their role in a scandal dubbed “Greek Watergate,” which dates back to 2022. The Greek […]

item.title: X tries wooing advertisers by letting them reuse creatives made for other platforms
item.description: X has launched an expanded set of aspect ratio support for both image and video ads, so advertisers can now reuse assets they've created for other platforms.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra vs iPhone 17 Pro (Max) : qui est le vrai roi des smartphones en 2026 ?
item.description: Apple et Samsung s'affrontent de nouveau. Entre l'innovant S26 Ultra et le puissant iPhone 17 Pro (Max), quel smartphone premium domine le marché ?

item.title: A Low-Cost MacBook Could Resemble a Chromebook in More Ways Than One
item.description: A sub-$1,000 MacBook would necessarily demand compromises, especially in the storage department.

item.title: Jamais un télescope n'avait lancé autant d’alertes cosmiques en une seule nuit : pourquoi c'est une rupture historique
item.description: Étoiles variables ou qui explosent en supernovae, trous noirs qui se déchaînent, astéroïdes menaçants. Ce sont toutes ces aiguilles dans l’immense botte de foin de l'Univers que l’observatoire Vera C. Rubin a commencé à traquer. Et il a déjà déclenché un nombre renversant d'alertes.

item.title: Zombie firms are an execution problem, not a demand problem
item.description: Zombie firms fail not from weak demand, but slow, fragmented execution across commercial systems.

item.title: Amazon fait chuter le prix du Google Pixel 9a et vole la vedette au Pixel 10a tout juste sorti
item.description: Le Google Pixel 9a voit son prix chuter à 348 euros au lieu de 549 euros, une belle réduction qui en fait le choix le plus malin face au récent Pixel 10a tout juste disponible.

item.title: Bumble announces AI-powered Profile Guidance and Photo Feedback
item.description: Bumble rolls out AI-suggested Profile Guidance and AI Photo Feedback today, and it's testing a Suggest a Date feature, too.

item.title: Walmart celebrates Pokémon’s 30th Anniversary with exclusive offers — here are 12 must-haves starting at $14.99
item.description: Walmart is celebrating Pokémon's 30th anniversary with exclusive offers and products that a super-fan would love — shop my 12 top picks from $14.99.

item.title: Hackers are harnessing AI to exploit security flaws faster than ever
item.description: As AI gets integrated, attacks speed up and grow in severity, so buisnesses should shape up.

item.title: Google might reshuffle search results to try to dodge fines in the EU
item.description: Google is planning to test changes to how it displays search results for certain topics, nearly a year after it was charged with violating antitrust rules in the European Union, Reuters reports. The shift will show top-ranked rival services for hotels, flights, restaurants, and transportation higher up in results, rather than prioritizing Google's own services […]...

item.title: Le Huawei Mate 80 Pro arrive en Europe : pourquoi c’est le smartphone le plus frustrant de 2026
item.description: Alors, on replonge ? Huawei vient de lever le voile sur la version globale du Mate 80 Pro. Un smartphone qui transpire la qualité, doté d'un capteur photo XMAGE à ouverture variable et d'une batterie de 5750 mAh.

item.title: Huawei FreeBuds Pro 5 : la promesse d’un son haute qualité et d’une réduction de bruit aussi bons qu’un casque ?
item.description: Les Huawei FreeBuds Pro 5 arrivent sur le segment des écouteurs true wireless premium avec l’ambition de proposer une réduction de bruit active plus intelligente et un son sans perte jusqu’alors réservé à des configurations filaires.

item.title: How to get the Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra for free at T-Mobile — no trade-in required

item.description: The latest round of layoffs marks eBay’s third workforce reduction in the past three years.

item.description: The HP OmniBook 7 Aero is light, surprisingly powerful, and comes at a good price for all that’s on offer.

item.description: Tim Cook a pris la parole sur les réseaux sociaux en amont de la grande semaine prévue par Apple. Il confirme que les annonces débuteront bien avant l'événement du 4 mars 2026.

item.title: 192.168.1.1 : comment accéder à l’interface administrateur de votre box internet ?
item.description: Pour piloter votre réseau local, dépanner votre connexion ou simplement changer le mot de passe du Wi-Fi, vous devrez accéder à l'interface utilisateur de votre box internet grâce à l'adresse IP 192.168.x.x. Ce guide vous aidera à savoir comment vous y prendre en fonction de votre fournisseur d'accès à internet.

item.title: We asked experts how to build a resume for the AI hiring era

As job search companies increasingly rely on artificial intelligence to sort through applications, job seekers wonder how to best position themselves with those filters in mind. We decided to speak directly with job search leaders about how a resume […]

item.title: Xbox is in danger. Will Microsoft fix it or kill it?
item.description: Today, we’re talking about the future of Xbox. Phil Spencer, a two–time Decoder guest who’s led Xbox for more than a decade, retired last week. But in a shocking twist, his deputy and long-assumed successor, Sarah Bond, is also out too, and the Xbox division is now in the hands of Asha Sharma, one of […]

item.title: « Personne ne veut du bâclé » : le patron de Microsoft en croisade contre les contenus médiocres générés par IA
item.description: Microsoft a beau être un des plus importants promoteurs de l'IA générative, l'éditeur a manifestement compris que son insistance à intégrer cette technologie au chausse-pied absolument partout pouvait taper sur les nerfs des utilisateurs. Ce d'autant que la qualité n'est pas forcément au rendez-vous — c'est le fameux « AI slop », ces contenus médiocres générés par l'IA. Satya Nadella en a conscience....

item.title: Amazon : attention, ce changement sur les listes d’envies permet à tous de voir votre adresse de livraison
item.description: Vous utilisez une liste d'envies Amazon pour recevoir des cadeaux ? Prudence, une modification imminente de la plateforme risque de dévoiler votre adresse personnelle à de parfaits inconnus. Dès le 25 mars 2026, la firme va faire sauter un verrou de confidentialité crucial, semant la panique chez de nombreux créateurs de contenu.

item.description: Get your credit cards ready.

item.title: Tim Cook confirms a week of Apple product reveals
item.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook has teased “a big week ahead" for Apple, starting on the morning of Monday, March 2. The company had already announced an in-person event for media and creators on March 4, while rumors had pointed toward Apple revealing at least five products over three days next week, so it looks like the stars are aligning for that to actually be the case. Cook all but confirmed that Apple is about to reveal its newest MacBooks in the coming days. His tweet features a short video of someone shaping an Apple logo on a surface that appears to have the company’s classic space gray colorway.A...

item.title: Stuff Your Kindle Day is here — score free sapphic books today only
item.description: The latest Stuff Your Kindle Day is live. Download free dark romance books for your Kindle on Dark Romance Day.

item.title: AI robotics company started by Alphabet is joining Google proper
item.description: Robotics company Intrinsic has announced it will be folding into Google as the company bets on the future of physical AI in manufacturing. The company focuses on software tools to make robots more affordable and easier to use, as well as using adaptive intelligence to help the robots perform real-world tasks. Intrinsic was started in 2021 as an Alphabet "Other Bets" project, part of a portfolio of high-risk and potentially high-payoff startups, Waymo among them. The project will now run as a "distinct group" within Google where it will leverage Gemini and Google Cloud while working closely wit...

item.title: Investigation: over 75% of Android VPNs fail basic transparency tests
item.description: Our research finds missing websites, absent privacy policies, and a lack of accountability across the Play Store.

item.description: Le Px7 S3 de Bowers & Wilkins est un casque qui se veut haut de gamme grâce à un design épuré et confortable. Vous pourrez le retrouver pour 30 % de moins chez Amazon.

item.title: Anthropic gives its retired Claude AI a Substack
item.description: In January, Anthropic "retired" Claude 3 Opus, which at one time was the company's most powerful AI model. Today, it's back - and writing on Substack. The newsletter, called Claude's Corner, will give Opus 3 space to publish its "musings, insights, or creative works," Anthropic said in a blog post. The model will post weekly […]

item.title: NVIDIA updates Shield TV after pledging further support
item.description: NVIDIA is a very busy company, and between all the graphics cards and AI-chasing, it wouldn’t be wholly surprising to see the company forget about its more niche offerings, such as the Android-powered NVIDIA Shield TV. Happily for all those who own one of these powerful set-top boxes, that doesn’t appear to be the case. Not only is NVIDIA continuing to support its Shield devices, but it’s just rolled out its first proper update in nearly a year. The Shield Experience Upgrade 9.2.4, to give it its proper name, applies to both the Shield and Shield Pro boxes. It’s admittedly light on new feature...

item.title: 'You’ve heard about the SaaSpocalypse? And it isn’t our first. We’ve had a few of them': Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff bullish over AI market potential
item.description: Marc Benioff says we're in another 'SaaSpocalypse', but companies that can change direction to accommodate agentic AI will be fine.

item.title: Après la suppression des formats HDR10+ et Dolby Vision, Disney+ supprime le HDR10
item.description: Début février, nous remontions l’information faisant état de la disparition des formats HDR10+ et Dolby Vision sur la plateforme de streaming Disney+. Aujourd’hui, il n’est même plus fait mention du format HDR10.

item.description: On June 9, 1,000+ founders, investors, and decision-makers will gather for TechCrunch Founder Summit 2026. This isn’t just foot traffic. It’s a full day of concentrated deal flow. An exhibit table turns that energy into measurable growth. You don’t need more awareness. You need customers, capital, and strategic partners. Secure your exhibit table and put your startup at the center of the startup universe. Why exhibiting drives real growth Direct access to buyers: […]...

item.title: Figma partners with OpenAI to bake in support for Codex
item.description: Figma is integrating OpenAI's coding assistant Codex a week after it announced a similar integration with Anthropic's Claude Code.
